channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Infuriating brainteaser challenges you to find the jellyfish among the sea of plastic bags
item.description: A baffling new brainteaser, created by British firm Bahari, is challenging eagle-eyed quiz aficionados to find the lone jellyfish lurking among a sea of plastic bags.

item.title: Debenhams's entire 14,000 workforce brace for bad news as retailer calls in liquidation experts
item.description: The struggling British department store chain has appointed Hilco Capital to draw up contingency plans should an attempt to sell the business end in failure, according to Sky News.

item.title: Captain of P&O cruise liner anchored off Devon coast tells of months as one of a handful aboard
item.description: Marcin Banach, who would usually be accompanied with over three thousand passengers and one thousand staff, is currently moored off Babbacombe Bay Torquay, on the luxury Azura cruiseliner.

item.title: Couple leave register office after getting married as receptions for up to 30 guests are allowed
item.description: Bride Sarneet Singh and groom Neil Bhadresha beamed as guests threw confetti when they left Kensington and Chelsea register office today.

item.title: Home sweet home: Harry and Meghan appear in Zoom interviews from their new $14.7m Montecito mansion
item.description: Harry's lecture on mental health from the 14,563-square-foot home in palm-tree lined Montecito, comes after his wife lashed the media's 'toxicity' in a separate video conference.

item.title: Queen thanks the heroes who 'fought so valiantly' to bring the Second World War to an end
item.description: In a special message on VJ (Victory in Japan) Day, the Queen and Duke of Edinburgh - gave 'grateful thanks' to all those who fought for the Allied nations.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Cressida Bonas's pop at Harry's £11million palace?
item.description: While Prince Harry and Meghan have spent £11 million on a mansion with nine bedrooms and 16 bathrooms (right), his ex, Cressida Bonas, is keen to make the point that she's happy with a simpler life.

item.title: Cyclist Remco Evenepoel rushed to hospital after falling 30ft off a BRIDGE in II Lombardia race
item.description: Footage showed the Deceuninck-Quick Step rider, who was part of a leading group, hitting the barriers on the side of the road before going over the top of his bike and falling off the bridge.

item.title: Four pubs in County Durham are forced to shut after customers and staff test positive for Covid
item.description: The Phoenix Club, The Ball Alley, East Stanley Working Men's Club and Stanley Empire Working Men's Club, all in Stanley, County Durham have been shut due to confirmed cases of the virus.

item.title: Man killed after being crushed by a massive fish that launched itself onto boat in freak accident
item.description: The 56-year-old, from the Northern Territory, was fishing with family and friends on the Darwin Harbour at Cullen Bay when tragedy struck about 4.30pm on Friday.

item.title: Cover your eyes Jamie! Bernard Matthews hints at the return of Turkey Twizzlers
item.description: Food manufacturer Bernard Matthews has hinted at the comeback of Turkey Twizzlers. The news may come as a blow to Jamie Oliver who campaigned for them to be cut out of school menus.

item.title: Infection map of France shows how only Paris and Marseilles have major outbreaks
item.description: France's two largest cities have both been declared high-risk Covid-19 zones, giving authorities more power to impose stricter control measures.

item.title: Mother watches in horror as car kills her son, six, while he rode his bike outside family home
item.description: Kidus Wondwosen died a short time after the collision in Wilmott Street in the Hulme area of Manchester around 6pm Sunday.

item.title: How to appeal against your A-level results: Ofqual reveals details on how pupils can contest marks
item.description: Ofqual said it would allow non-exam assessment marks to be used to 'make sure this opportunity is available to a wide range of students, including those who had not taken a written mock exam'

item.title: Thunderstorms sweep Britain as three-day deluge begins
item.description: The Met Office has issued a yellow thunderstorm warning for vast swathes of England and Wales on both Saturday and Sunday. This week brought soaring temperatures before storms moved in.

item.title: Owner of 'devil dog' is anti-gang social worker, 36, who has a son with grime rapper Giggs
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Naomi Salawu, who owns the bullmastiff that killed another dog, is a social worker and manager of troubled youngsters at south-east London's Youth Offending Team.

item.title: Prince Andrew appears to hum a tune at the wheel of his car, while brother attends VJ Day memorial
item.description: Prince Andrew, who was forced to stand down from royal duties following his disastrous BBC Newsnight interview, was pictured today driving from Windsor Castle, alone.

item.title: From walking trails to Michelin-starred restaurants, the best things to do in Ribble Valley
item.description: The Daily Mail's Teresa Levonian visited Ribble Valley in Lancashire. She explored its stunning walking trails and spent a merry afternoon at the award-winning Goosnargh 'gin school'.

item.title: Meghan Markle decries the 'toxicity' she has faced in the media
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, interviewed The 19th* co-founder and CEO Emily Ramshaw. The 19th* is a nonprofit, nonpartisan newsroom focused on gender and politics.

item.title: Royal Family and Boris Johnson will join Second World War veterans to mark 75 years since VJ Day
item.description: On the 75th anniversary of Victory in Japan Day, ceremonies are being held around the world before the Royal Family join UK PM Boris Johnson and veterans for a red arrows flypast.

item.title: Bugatti Chiron and Porsche 911 crash as both drivers try to overtake slow-moving motorhome
item.description: The Bugatti and the Porsche collided before the Porsche hit the Mercedes and the Bugatti hit the motorhome on the Gotthard Pass in the Swiss Alps causing damage worth £3 million.

item.title: California orders rolling blackouts for up to 250,000 homes and businesses
item.description: Grid managers last implemented such a power cut in 2001, when the state was suffering from an electric crisis.

item.title: Traveller dubbed the 'King of Sheffield' is taken to final resting place
item.description: Willy Collins, was carried from outside the Old Ball pub in Darnall, past Pitsmoor, where he grew up, and through Sheffield's streets in a gold coffin before his funeral service at Shiregreen Cemetery.

item.title: Rapist, 21, who attempted to murder his victim is jailed for life
item.description: Aaron Murphy, pictured, was jailed for life after he admitted raping a woman twice and attempting to murder her during an attack in Harrow, north west London in May.

item.title: Britons flooded back from France in a bid to beat the quarantine deadline
item.description: Families made a last-minute dash across the Channel last night ahead of the 4am cut-off this morning when France was added to the UK's quarantine list.

item.title: Migrants make desperate Channel dash in dinghy only to be caught by Border Force
item.description: Some 1,004 migrants were brought ashore by Border Force between August 4 and 13. This takes the total so far this year to at least 4,511, more than double the amount thought to have crossed in 2019.

item.title: Britain records HIGHEST infection rate for a Saturday in EIGHT weeks with 1,012 new Covid cases
item.description: Today's rise of 1,012 new Covid- 19 cases - which are more than 200 cases higher than week - mark the biggest Saturday increase since 1,295 cases were reported on June 20.

item.title: Royal Navy's newest £100m warship HMS Trent breaks down
item.description: The HMS Trent, a 90-metre warship, had to be dragged back to its first port of call in Gibraltar, just nine days after setting sail from Portsmouth. They had to call out the tugs to get her back.

item.title: Will I get a refund because I can't fly to France due to FCO advice?
item.description: I booked a trip to go to France next month prior to the original lockdown restrictions in March. I bought travel insurance at the time. Will I get a full refund?

item.title: Grounded 1,000-ton oil tanker BREAKS IN HALF after catastrophic spill off Mauritius
item.description: Pictures of the boat which ran aground off Mauritius in late July show the cargo ship completely torn in two parts, while officials argue over who will pay for the clean up costs.

item.title: Iranian musician, 30, is arrested over claims he let women sing and dance in online art video
item.description: Mehdi Rajabian, 30, who has already been imprisoned twice on charges relating to his music, said he was summoned to the Court of Sari on Tuesday morning by a police officer.

item.title: Inside Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's $14.7m Santa Barbara mansion
item.description: The Duke, 35, and Duchess of Sussex, 39, bought the sprawling nine-bedroom and 16-bathroom mansion in upscale Montecito, Santa Barbara, for $14.65million on June 18.

item.title: British Dynasty star Emma Samms, 59, tells of six-month 'Long Covid' hell
item.description: Former Dynasty Emma Samms, 59, who tested positive for Covid in March, has spoken of being one of the 'long covid' sufferers. She reports having 'panic inducing levels of fatigue'.

item.title: 'Don't underestimate Joe's ability to f-things up' - Obama shares his private doubts on former VP
item.description: Barack Obama allegedly cautioned another Democrat not to 'underestimate Joe's ability to f**k things up' as he voiced private concerns about his former VP's fitness for office.

item.title: Furious A-level student confronts schools minister after she was downgraded THREE grades
item.description: Nina Bunting-Mitchem, from Peterborough challenged Nick Gibb on Radio 4's Any Questions after she didn't get the grades she expected and didn't get into any chosen veterinary schools.

item.title: Belarus leader appeals to Russia as pressure to quit grows
item.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Saturday issued an appeal to long-term ally Russia as he faced growing pressure to step down following a disputed election.

item.title: Crowds return to the Crucible for World Snooker Championship final in Sheffield
item.description: A socially-distanced audience of 300 in the 980-capacity arena in Sheffield has been permitted after the Government made a late U-turn to allow limited numbers inside.

item.title: Russian billionaire faces US extradition
item.description: Russian banker Oleg Tinkov, pictured, is due to appear at Westminster Magistrates' Court next month as US authorities attempt to extradite him over an alleged tax fraud.

item.title: £500bn city investment firm tells staff they can work from home permanently
item.description: Investment management firm Schroeders has told staff they no longer need to come into the office. The firm, moved into new state-of-the-art offices near Moorgate in 2018, pictured.

item.title: SARAH VINE says the chaos and incompetence over this week's A-level results is the final betrayal
item.description: SARAH VINE slams 'chaos and incompetence' behind this week's grade fiasco as the final betrayal of disadvantaged children hit hardest by lockdown

item.title: Casinos, bowling alleys, theatres, gig venues and wedding receptions can reopen from today
item.description: Businesses said they are 'delighted' to be welcoming back customers as entertainment and other indoor venues reopen today during the latest easing of lockdown restrictions in England.

item.title: Princes Charles leads well-wishers as his sister Anne turns 70
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, sent the Princess Royal, who is thought to spending the day on a sailing trip around the west coast of Scotland, birthday congratulations on his Instagram account.

item.title: Student, 18, with rare terminal cancer was told he wouldn't make it to 2020
item.description: Joseph Lunn, from Mitcham, south London, was diagnosed with synovial sarcoma, a rare and incurable cancer in his abdomen. He was told he wouldn't make it to 2020.

item.title: Will Young reveals homophobic thugs threatened to stab him for holding hands with his boyfriend
item.description: The Pop Idol winner, 41, has revealed that homophobic thugs had once threatened to stab him for holding hands with a boyfriend.

item.title: Police speed camera van ends up in hedge after crash with van
item.description: A police speed trap van was shunted into a hedge after it was struck by another van in Horncastle, Lincolnshire , pictured. Luckily neither the camera operator or second van driver was injured.

item.title: Film reveals impact of Trump's plans and his organisation's treatment of those who lived nearby
item.description: Documentary film maker Anthony Baxter made You've Been Trumped Too to reveal the consequences of his ambitious plans in Scotland after residents were left without water

item.title: Third teenager, 17, is charged with murder over churchyard killing
item.description: A 17-year-old youth from the Merseyside area, who cannot be named, was due to appear at Manchester Magistrates' Court on Saturday after a 19 and 13-year old have already been charged.

item.title: Builder sparks security alert by leaving top secret designs for Parliament at GREGGS
item.description: A staff member at the bakery chain in Westminster, London, is thought to have picked up the plans on Wednesday and skimmed over them, before handing the documents over to police.

item.title: Celebs love to paddleboard in exotic locations, but what's it like for a beginner in Pembrokeshire?
item.description: The Daily Mail's Harriet Sime went stand-up paddleboarding with TYF Adventure in Solva harbour, Pembrokeshire. She said it was 'harder but far more invigorating than it looks'.

item.title: Britons shun foreign holidays amid quarantine chaos
item.description: The cost of holidays to quarantine-free Turkey and Greece has plunged by 28 per cent on average while a week-long trip to Italy has halved in price, comparison website Travel Supermarket found.

item.title: Midwife shares insider tips to getting your baby to sleep
item.description: Shared with FEMAIL, the midwife's advice comes after British company Owlet ran a study with 2,000 parents, which revealed three in 10 parents would give up sex for more sleep.

item.title: Stamp duty cut adds £30,000 to average property asking price with sales up 20%
item.description: Thousands more sales were made every week, particularly in the north of England and Wales, than before the coronavirus lockdown, according to the statistics from the Bank of England.

item.title: ANTONIA HOYLE and her family try hundreds of new taste-alike products
item.description: ANTONIA HOYLE: In a bid to stop Waitrose fans deserting Ocado in their droves, M&S is introducing similar versions of some of Waitrose's bestselling products.

item.title: Brave husband punches shark to save his wife's life during a surfing trip at a popular NSW beach
item.description: Chantelle Doyle, 35, was surfing with her husband and friends at Shelly Beach in Port Macquarie, on the mid-north coast when she was attacked about 9.30am.

item.title: Woman reveals she's completely overhauled her bathroom after separating from her abusive ex-husband
item.description: A British mother took to Facebook to show off her bathroom makeover and explain that her abusive partner had forbidden her from ever redecorating the house they had shared.

item.title: National Trust will keep the majority of 'distressing' artefacts linked to slavery
item.description: The announcement comes as the heritage charity said its in the process of issuing a report, which has taken over a year to compile, which reveals that a third of homes are linked to slavery.

item.title: Jihadi bride, 25, is back in UK after flying into Heathrow using her British passport
item.description: Samia Hussein, 25, was detained by anti-terror police after she flew into Heathrow Airport on February 12. Hussein was held on suspicion of membership of a banned organisation.

item.title: Pilfering at the Palace: Police arrest Queen's servant after a spate of thefts
item.description: The Companion of the Order of the Bath medal belonging to the Master of the Household, Tony Johnstone-Burt OBE, was discovered listed on the auction website for £350.

item.title: Thousands of schools to defy union 'scaremongering' and open full-time from next month
item.description: Town halls across England have worked with schools to draw up detailed plans on how to keep pupils and staff safe and have overwhelmingly pledged a return.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle phoned fan linked to Twitter TROLL
item.description: The woman, who Prince Harry and Meghan Markle told they were 'so moved and happy' after she raised £45,000, runs another Twitter account which has branded the Duchess of Cambridge a 'b****'.

item.title: Millionaire matchmaker reveals the 'toxic side' of maintaining an 'elegant image'
item.description: London-based Anna Bey, 34, who goes by the moniker 'JetSetBabe' online, revealed the outdated stereotypes that she believes no longer fit elegant women in her latest YouTube clip.

item.title: Eat Out To Help Out scheme serves 10.5m meals in its first three days
item.description: The number of people visiting pubs, cafes and restaurants has tripled in a month as Rishi Sunak's Eat Out To Help Out scheme has inspired workers to leave their homes and spend.

item.title: Happy birthday Princess Royal! Elegant Anne stuns in three new portraits to mark turning 70
item.description: The Princess Royal's 70th birthday has been marked with the release of three official photographs taken at her Gatcombe Park home in Gloucestershire. to celebrate the milestone.

item.title: Ulrika Jonsson reveals the meanings of her 13 tattoos including the red devil on her derrière
item.description: The TV personality, 52, opened up about the meanings behind her tattoos including the red devil on her derrière which she acquired after she was exposed for cheating on her first husband.

item.title: City worker returns after 4-year voyage around the world
item.description: Thom D'Arcy quit his job in the city in 2016 to buy a yacht and sail around the world. He said he got bored of his 'rat race' life and decided to buy a boat instead of a one-bed apartment.

item.title: Now all schools will be able to appeal for FREE against A-level grades
item.description: Under-fire education secretary Gavin Williamson said that the government would cover the appeal costs to ensure that head teachers are not put off from making appeals by the cost.

item.title: Talented artist creates incredible tiny replicas of beloved animals
item.description: Talented artist Alyson Gurney, 24, from Washington, DC, felts the wool together in incredibly accurate sculptures while carefully studying photos of the pets.

item.title: What is driving the house price mini-boom in lockdown?
item.description: Since the government lifted the ban on moving home estate agents have reported a surge in buyer enquiries, house prices have remained strong, and mortgage applications have rebounded.

item.title: How clubs will be able to make television-style broadcasts of live matches in bid to boost interest
item.description: The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) is set to give clubs a video-production kit, including a four-metre mast and camera with live-streaming software, made by Frogbox.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's widow Lissie reveals her torment
item.description: Exactly a year ago Lissie Harper, a beautiful young newlywed, was woken in the early hours by a loud knock on her front door.

item.title: AMANDA PLATELL: Police close the Stephen Lawrence murder case, but I pray this isn't the end
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: Had he not been stabbed to death by racist thugs at a bus stop on April 22, 1993, Stephen Lawrence would now be 45 years old.

item.title: Leeds residents generate 50% more CO2 per day than Londoners
item.description: A team from Utility Bidder crunched the numbers to work out just how much CO2 we individually produce and which areas of the country have the highest levels.

item.title: Hyperion's 220mph hydrogen car runs 1,000 miles on a tank
item.description: Coming in 2022, the XP-1 from Hyperion can go from zero to 60mph in a staggering 2.2 seconds, reaching a top speed of more than 221mph. And the whisper-quiet car takes only minutes to refuel.

item.title: Soon-to-be Lord Botham speaks out on 'jealous' carping over his peerage
item.description: Today, their marriage is one of the strongest in sport but Lord Botham concedes it's 'a miracle' he and his wife Kath have celebrated more than 40 years together.

item.title: New Zealand records seven new cases of coronavirus overnight as Jetstar cancels all flights
item.description: New Zealand's Ministry of Health Director-General Dr Ashley Bloomfield and Health Minister Chris Hipkins announced the country recorded seven new coronavirus cases on Saturday morning.

item.title: Average HS2 worker costs the taxpayer £94,824 a year
item.description: The figures will raise fresh questions over the huge costs of the HS2 project, which have already spiralled out of control from £36billion in 2012 to an estimated £106billion.

item.title: What aircraft gunner Paul Newman said after nuclear attacks on Japan ended the war 75 years ago
item.description: As Britain marks the anniversary of Victory over Japan (VJ) today, the Mail shares the memories from that historic day, including some of the worst experiences of the war in the Far East ..

item.title: Testing travellers on arrival in Britain and again later on 'could reduce quarantine time'
item.description: Documents from UK's SAGE group show that show that when arrivals are 'double tested', there's hardly any difference between quarantining for ten days compared to a fortnight.

item.title: Pink cars grow more popular among UK drivers joining the likes of Paris Hilton and Nicki Minaj
item.description: An increasing number of celebrities, including Paris Hilton, Nicki Minaj (pictured) and Katie Price have recently been seen with luxury pink cars.

item.title: More than 1,800 Post Office employees may have been wrongfully accused of taking money from the till
item.description: Hundreds of postmasters were sacked, went bankrupt or were wrongfully convicted after amounts appeared to vanish from their tills.

item.title: Fitness buff builds £1bn Gymshark clothes brand from parents' garage
item.description: After being taught to sew by his mother, Ben Francis and a group of friends set up Gymshark when he was just 19. US private equity giant General Atlantic has snapped up a 21 per cent stake.

item.title: Breast cancer patients face 'cruel' postcode lottery for fertility treatment
item.description: Chemotherapy given to young women with breast cancer can leave them infertile, meaning many choose to freeze an embryo or their eggs for future IVF (file photo).

item.title: Second World War veteran who survived kamikaze attacks dies aged 94 just three days before VJ Day
item.description: Richard Edser, 94, from Harlow in Essex, survived kamikaze attacks on board the HMS Formidable aircraft carrier during his service in East Asia.
item.media:description: Richard Edser, 94, who served on the HMS Formidable, died on August 12 (Taxi Charity/PA)

item.title: Trump orders Chinese owner of TikTok to sell US assets
item.description: Trump's executive order said there is 'credible evidence that leads me to believe that ByteDance... might take action that threatens to impair the national security of the United States.'

item.title: Young Army officers must be 'more unconventional' in warfare and master 'cyber and space'
item.description: The Defence Secretary Ben Wallace told Sandhurst graduates that the highly anticipated Integrated Defence and Security review will bring with it new expectations of officers.

item.title: New South Wales records nine new cases of coronavirus
item.description: Of the new cases two are staff members from Chopstix Asian Cuisine in Smithfield RSL.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Harry Enfield leaves his wife of 23 years who once hailed his 'huge sex appeal'
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Harry Enfield's wife, Lucy, once hailed his 'huge sex appeal' but she's now found that life with the celebrated comedian is no laughing matter.

item.title: Trump says 'every city will be under siege' if Joe and Kamala win and tells cops to 'fight back'
item.description: Donald Trump has told a gathering of 'Cops for Trump' at his Bedminster golf club that 'no one will be safe' if Joe Biden wins. Trump was presented with a statue by the police union president.

item.title: HBO Max puts trigger warning on Western spoof Blazing Saddles due to 'racist language and attitudes'
item.description: Blazing Saddles, the much-loved 1974 spoof Western, is currently streaming on HBO Max with a warning about the 'racist language and attitudes' contained in the film.

item.title: How Lucy Wyndham-Read suffered heartbreak aged 21 when her fiancé died while playing around with gun
item.description: At just 5ft 3in and a dress size eight, Lucy Wyndham-Read is a tiny presence but one who packs a formidable punch - metaphorically speaking.

item.title: £6.85m foreign aid scheme accused of 'funnelling aid to firms'
item.description: Working with charities including Care UK, the scheme promises to help workers living in Myanmar, Bangladesh, Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia, Tanzania, Rwanda and Ghana.

item.title: Questions raised after former builder used fake CVs to become an NHS boss and make £1million
item.description: Jon Andrewes, 67, told 'staggering lies' on his CVs to become an NHS boss. Considering how easily he fooled his bosses, the question is: How many other CV conmen are still out there?

item.title: Nearly 3,000 Oxford graduates urge university to admit students hit by downgraded A-levels
item.description: Oxford alumni called on the university to show 'kindness and generosity' to students whose marks had been 'unexpectedly and unfairly downgraded by an algorithm'.

item.title: Never use a dog nappy to tint your eyelashes!
item.description: TRINNY WOODALL: During lockdown, with salons closed, many women feared for their beauty regimes.

item.title: Obama: Trump aims to 'kneecap Post Office' to discourage voters
item.description: Barack Obama slammed President Donald Trump for trying to 'actively kneecap' the postal service to disenfranchise voters.

item.title: Losing weight before middle age 'can halve death risk'
item.description: Reductions in body mass index between these two life stages is critical to extending lifespan, US researchers reveal.

item.title: BBC to crack down on use of 'racially insulting language' after N-word row
item.description: BBC editorial director Kamal Ahmed told staff any racist language on news and current affairs shows should be referred to director of news Fran Unsworth (pictured).

item.title: Students fear no university until 2021...even if they win their A-level appeal
item.description: Lucy Lipfriend (right) thinks her grades were downgraded because of last year's performance, taken after her mother's breast cancer diagnosis, being taken into account.

item.title: Woman bakes cake that looks identical to a dirty dish sponge
item.description: Abi, a 20-year-old amateur baker, shared footage of herself munching on the cake before giving a behind-the-scenes look at how it was made.

item.title: Trevor Engelson's uncle hits back at claim Meghan Markle's first husband couldn't cope with her fame
item.description: Meghan Markle and Trevor Engelson were inseparable boyfriend and girlfriend before just 23 months of marriage and a sudden split but the reasons why have always remained undisclosed.

item.title: UFO bass player Pete Way has died aged 69 after suffering 'life threatening' injuries
item.description: The legendary founder of the iconic rock band died with his wife Jenny by his side on Friday morning.

item.title: Missing 6ft bird is reunited with her owner... then goes on the run AGAIN two days later
item.description: Ethel the emu has gone on the run from her home near Doncaster, South Yorkshire, for the second time in a week, to the bemusement of locals, the police and the RSPCA.

item.title: Convicted Troubles terrorists excluded from victims' compensation payments
item.description: Sinn Fein is boycotting the initiative because it believes the UK Government's approach could exclude thousands of injured people from Northern Ireland's republican community.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's new neighbors
item.description: Meghan and Harry bought the nine-bedroom and 16-bathroom mansion in the secluded area of Riven Rock in upscale Montecito in June for $14.65M.

item.title: BREAKING NEWS: Donald Trump's brother Robert hospitalized
item.description: White House officials on Friday confirmed President Trump's younger brother, Robert, 72, has been admitted to the hospital in New York. He was described as 'very ill', but his condition is unknown.

item.title: Exclusive first look at All Creatures Great and Small
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: All Creatures Great and Small returns to screens on Channel 5 this September after a 30-year absence. The first trailer, shared exclusively with FEMAIL, shows romance blossoming.

item.title: JOHN HUMPHRYS: I couldn't work with Prince Harry when he guest edited BBC Radio 4's Today programme
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: I knew what would happen. I would want to ask what his minders would regard as impertinent or embarrassing questions and that would be the end of that.

item.title: Michael Cohen seen after bombshell details from book revealed
item.description: DailyMail.com spotted Michael Cohen in New York City on Friday, the day after he published a sneak of 'Disloyal' - his upcoming memoir about his years-long relationship with Donald Trump.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres mansion burglary was 'inside job' cops allegedly tell neighbors
item.description: Police allegedly told residents in Ellen DeGeneres' Montecito neighborhood that the recent burglary at the TV host's property was an 'inside job'.

item.title: Make sure children get lifesaving jabs to avoid piling more pressure on the NHS, parents are urged
item.description: Parents are not taking their children for routine vaccinations as many have put it off during the coronavirus epidemic. Only 1 in 4 parents feel comfortable taking their child to a GP surgery.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: SAGE fear public toilets will harbour virus
item.description: Scientists advising the British Government warned public toilets can become crowded and are likely to harbour the virus on numerous cold surfaces.

item.title: Denise Van Outen, 45, reveals she is gearing up for the menopause with oestrogen-boosting gels
item.description: Denise Van Outen, 45, poses in fishnets and tassels as she reveals she is combating the onset of menopause with the use of unregulated bioidentical gels. Says she 'felt great' again since taking them.

item.title: Two boys are robbed at GUNPOINT by teen at lemonade stand
item.description: Surveillance video captured the moment Jude Peterson and his friend were robbed outside his home in Peoria, southwest of Chicago, last Friday afternoon.

item.title: Britain's economy on course for rapid recovery, predicts Bank of England chief
item.description: Chief economist Andy Haldane (pictured) says strong consumer spending has already helped the UK claw back as much as half of the losses triggered by the pandemic.

item.title: Only THREE PER CENT of staff at Department of Education headquarters were in work on results day
item.description: Only 3 per cent of staff in London turned up to the Department for Education headquarters in Whitehall on Thursday, the Daily Mail can reveal.

item.title: Swimmer to cross the Channel and stay in France for just TEN MINUTES to avoid quarantine
item.description: The quarantine rules have left swimmer Chloe McCardel holding her breath - as the rising tide of Covid cases on the continent may force her into self-isolation.

item.title: Baffling riddle that most Harvard grads struggle to answer stumps TikTok
item.description: Jack Fanshawe, 22, from New York, took to TikTok on Thursday to recite what has become known as the 'I turn polar bears white' riddle online.

item.title: Divorcee is awarded Russian billionaire ex-husband's £340m superyacht and £110m art collection
item.description: Tatiana Akhmedova, who lives in London, was awarded a 41.5% share of businessman Farkhad Akhmedov's £1 billion-plus fortune by a British judge in late 2016 but has so far only received £5 million

item.title: BEL MOONEY: How do I tell my family I'm dating a divorced dad-of-three?
item.description: This week Bel Mooney advises a woman on how to tell her family she is seeing an older divorced dad of three.

item.title: Couple find an asylum seeker hidden in their bike rack
item.description: John and Debbie Marriott spent two weeks holidaying in their camper van. Nearing their home in Worthing, West Sussex, the pair joked about mysterious noises behind them.

item.title: Woman, 31, passes gets driving licence after SEVENTEEN tests
item.description: Blessing Platinum-Williams was finally handed a pass last month after embarking on an intensive course in Watford at the start of lockdown.

item.title: Brad Pitt SLAMS Angelina Jolie's 'Hail Mary' filing as a 'tactical gambit' to delay custody trial
item.description: Brad Pitt has fired back at ex-wife Angelina Jolie via his legal team, after she filed a request to remove Judge John W. Ouderkirk from their almost four-year divorce battle on Thursday.

item.title: Victoria's Secret accused of ripping off black-founded brands
item.description: Victoria's Secret put out lingerie items that look strikingly similar to pieces by British brand Edge o' Beyond. The brand's founder found a past purchase from a VS designer for those items.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon causes holiday chaos for thousands by DEMANDING France is put on quarantine list
item.description: Eurostar has warned that many travellers may not be able to get back to the UK after the Prime Minister made the eleventh hour decision to add France to the UK's quarantine list.

item.title: Man says travellers forced him into Tesco baby food blackmail
item.description: Nigel Wright, 45 is on trial at the Old Bailey for allegedly trying to extort nearly £1.5 million in cryptocurrency from the supermarket chain because he was angry at being underpaid for milk.

item.title: Lightning strikes a palm tree on a clear day in Florida video
item.description: The unusual footage, referred to as a 'Bolt from the Blue' by meteorologists was captured from the inside of a Florida man's car, while he was around 75ft away from the strike.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon's pandemic: From gazumping ministers to using Westminster cash to boost popularity
item.description: The SNP leader has consistently out-maneuvered Boris Johnson's Government during the coronavirus pandemic but finds herself in hot water over France quarantine.

item.title: France vows to retaliate with quarantine against British travellers
item.description: Emmanuel Macron's transport minister said France 'regrets the UK's decision' and 'will apply reciprocal measures' after people crossing the Channel were ordered to isolate for 14 days.

item.title: Renewable biogas from COW MANURE is injected into the UK Grid
item.description: The biomethane connected to the Gas National Transmission System at the end of July by anaerobic digestion company BioCow from a farm in Cambridgeshire.

item.title: Thai king commutes death sentence for Myanmar men in British tourist murder case
item.description: Two migrants from Myanmar on death row in Thailand for the murder of two British backpackers had their sentences commuted to life in prison. Zaw Lin and Win Zaw Htun were sentenced.
